newsitem.title: INDIA: India's TELCO to produce small cars.
newsitem.headline: India's TELCO to produce small cars.

text.p: Indian automobile firm Tata Engineering and Locomotive Company Ltd (TELCO) will produce 150,000 units per year at its small car plant when at full capacity, chairman Ratan Tata told shareholders on Wednesday.
Small car production is expected to begin by end 1998.
Tata said he expected the Indian small car market size to be 600,000 to 700,000 a year by 2000.
The total Indian car market is expected to grow to between 800,000 and one million by 2000, he told shareholders at an annual general meeting on Wednesday.
Tata said TELCO earmarked 17.0 billion rupees for the small car project out of a projected 45.0 billion capital expenditure plan for the company until 2000.
He said about 55 percent of the 45 billion rupees will be raised through internal accruals and the balance mostly through borrowings.

TELCO plans to launch a small car, tentatively christened "Indicar", to take on Maruti 800, India's largest selling car which is produced by Maruti Udyog, a joint venture of Suzuki Motor of Japan and the Indian government.
TELCO is India's largest truck maker.
